Set the Euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] degrees. 2. Set the translation vector to [0.0, 0.0625, 0.0]. **Generate the 2D sketch** 1. Create a new face. 2. Draw the first line from point (0.0, 0.0) to point (0.75, 0.0). 3. Draw the second line from point (0.75, 0.0) to point (0.5938, 0.1562). 4. Draw the third line from point (0.5938, 0.1562) to point (0.3125, 0.1562). 5. Draw the fourth line (arc) from point (0.3125, 0.1562) to point (0.0625, 0.1562), with midpoint at (0.1875, 0.2812). 6. Draw the fifth line from point (0.0625, 0.1562) to point (0.0, 0.1562). 7. Draw the sixth line from point (0.0, 0.1562) to point (0.0, 0.0). **Generate the 3D model** 1. Close the loop by connecting the last point to the first point using the straight line. 2. Scale the 2D sketch using the scaling parameter 0.75. 3. Transform the scaled 2D sketch to 3D space using the current coordinate system. 4. Extrude the sketch with 0.0625 units in the normal direction and 0 units in the opposite direction. 5. Label the part as "base_part". **Record the description** 1. Set the shape as "A rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center. The prism has a flat top and bottom. The hole is cylindrical with a smaller diameter than the prism. The prism is centered on the x-axis and is slightly offset on the y-axis. The height of the prism is approximately twice the width. The hole is located in the center of the prism. The prism is gray." 2. Set the length as 0.75 units. 3. Set the width as 0.0625 units. 4. Set the height as 0.75 units.</description>
